page.title: 07A LOCAL FARM
page.content: Bells Forstal farm is owned by Mr Roger Scutt. The farm covers 450 acres. Most of the land is used for growing crops. This year Mr Scutt has barley (100 acres), wheat (300 acres), grass (35 acres),and oats (15 acres). He also owns 200 cattle, of which 140 are dairy cows, and 100 sheep. These are kept on fields outside the Throwley area, but do come to the farm for the winter months. The farm has 10 tractors, 2 combine harvesters, a forklift truck and lots of accessories such as cultivators sprayers and trailors. Mr Scutt employs 6 workers. The greatest problems are planning work because of the weather, maintaining machinery, and regular spraying against weeds pests and fungi It costs about half a million pounds a year to run the farm.
